contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=October 2010}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = The Blue Ox Babes | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[English Midlands|The Midlands]], England | instrument = | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Pop rock]] | occupation = | years_active = 1981â€“1988 | label = [[Go! Discs Records|Go! Discs]] | associated_acts = [[Dexys Midnight Runners]] | website = | current_members = | past_members =[[Kevin Archer]]<br>Yasmin Saleh<br>[[Andy Leek]]<br>[[Helen O'Hara]]<br>Pete Wain<br>Nick Smith<br>Ian Pettitt<br>Steve 'Brennan' Shaw<br>Steve Wynne | notable_instruments = }} '''The Blue Ox Babes''' were an [[England|English]] [[pop music|pop]] group, formed in early 1981 by the former [[Dexys Midnight Runners]] guitarist [[Kevin Archer|Kevin 'Al' Archer]], together with his girlfriend Yasmin Saleh, and former Dexys keyboard player [[Andy Leek]]. Archer was keen to mix the [[soul music|soul]] sounds of his previous group with folk styles. To this end he recruited fiddle player [[Helen O'Hara]] to play on demo tapes of the new songs he had written. When former colleague [[Kevin Rowland]] heard these demo tapes, he invited O'Hara to join Dexys, and adopted a similarly folk-influenced sound for his own group. By the time The Blue Ox Babes finally released their debut single "There's No Deceiving You" on [[Go! Discs Records|Go! Discs]] in 1988, the line-up consisted of Archer (guitar and vocals), Saleh (backing vocals), Pete Wain (piano), Nick Smith (saxophone), Ian Pettitt (drums), former Dexys members Steve 'Brennan' Shaw (fiddle), and Steve Wynne (bass). "There's No Deceiving You" was only a minor chart entry, peaking at No. 92 UK. Two other singles, "Apples and Oranges" and "Walking On The Line", were released, but sales were disappointing and these singles did not chart. A planned album ''Apples & Oranges'' was recorded by the group but shelved, and the Blue Ox Babes broke up shortly thereafter. In 2009, a CD of ''Apples & Oranges'' was finally released, containing all their recordings for Go! Discs, through [[Cherry Red Records]]. The package included all their singles plus many unreleased songs - and several additional demos were also made available as downloads. ==Members== *[[Kevin Archer]] - guitar, vocals <small>(1981-1988)</small> *Yasmin Saleh - vocals <small>(1981-1988)</small> *[[Andy Leek]] - keyboards <small>(1981-1988)</small> *[[Helen O'Hara]] - fiddle <small>(1982)</small> *Pete Wain - piano <small>(1988)</small> *Nick Smith - saxophone <small>(1988)</small> *Ian Pettitt - drums <small>(1988)</small> *Steve 'Brennan' Shaw - fiddle <small>(1988)</small> *Steve Wynne - bass <small>(1988)</small> ==Discography== ===Singles=== * "There's No Deceiving You" / "The Last Detail" / "Take Me To The River" (1988) * "Apples And Oranges" / "Pray Lucky" / "Yes Let's" / "Russia in Winter" (1988) * "Walking On The Line" / "Four Golden Tongues Talk" / "What Does Anybody Ever Think About" / "Thought As Much" (1988) ===Albums=== * ''Apples & Oranges'' (recorded 1988, issued 2009) ==External links== *[http://www.cherryred.co.uk/cherryred/artists/blueoxbabes.htm Blue Ox Babes' Apples & Oranges CD page] *[http://www.myspace.com/theblueoxbabes The Blue Ox Babes' MySpace page] *[http://www.dexys.org/blueoxbabes.html Blues Ox Babes page within Dexys Midnight Runners website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Blue Ox Babes, The}} [[Category:English pop music groups]] [[Category:English New Wave musical groups]]
